website_summaries.verdict: Although it may take you a little extra work to get the results you want, this Truper lawn edger is a useful tool for maintaining a well-manicured look.
pros: Cuts straight lines close to sidewalks and driveways thanks to the rotary blade situated on a dual wheel for enhanced mobility
Has a solid ash wood handle that's built to last
cons: Requires several passes to work through tough soil, and may not cut dense grass or weeds
There is a learning curve to using it

customer_reviews.title: Must Have Tool for You Lawn Care
customer_reviews.text: A powered edger won't work in my case. I have inlay flagstones and exposed aggregate finish along the edges. This edger solved my problem. It works great and as advertised! The blades are sharp which cut the grass with ease. I had to move the edger back and forth multiple times in order to get a clean edge. I also found out this tool can edge on the non-hard surface. See photos for before and after attempt.
customer_reviews.author: Quan

customer_reviews.title: Manicured Lawns
customer_reviews.text: I let my driveway get overgrown because I ran out of line for my weed eater. Also, I fear my weed eater. The noise, flying debris, and use are beyond my abilities. While talking with a friend she mentioned this type of tool and I was super interested. As you can see, it does a great job. Although it does require you to work a bit I consider it part of my weekend workout. Plus future maintenance is going to be considerably easier. This also works well for the driveway cracks but you can avoid foliage using roundup.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Lane

customer_reviews.title: Standard Hand-Push Lawn Edger
customer_reviews.text: I've used Truper and other brand hand lawn edgers for years. This one works as expected. I have about 200' of edging to do each time I mow, and I mow approximately weekly April thru September and a few other times in spring and fall for 4-5,000' of edging a year. Typically, the blade wears down and the rubber wears off the wheel after about 5 years. I've been looking for a heavier duty model, but have not been able to find one. Apparently there is not a great demand for these kind of human-powered edgers.
customer_reviews.author: R. Longtoe

customer_reviews.title: What are you going to do...!?!!!
customer_reviews.text: Let me tell you something mean jean! You better be ready for when the tru tough edger shows up at your door brother! This little piece of equipment right here is going to beat you senseless from one end of your yard to the other...dude...as exercise equipment this edger is fantastic. You will be incredibly pumped up after a grueling session with the tru tough edger...it also functions as an edger and does a good job. It was tough going in overgrown Florida st Augustine grass but after this initial use it should be easier from now on.
customer_reviews.author: JWF

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Of my many hundreds of purchases at Amazon, this edger ranks #1 in purchases for so many reasons. Now living in Lithuania, I had to ship it in my luggage. A friend cut it in half and made a sleeve to reassemble it upon receipt. Well for over 30 hours, we used it for over 100 meters of paver edging that hadn't been done for years at our new property by the previous owner. It performed outstanding in all ways and cleaned well. Now we are on our second round of usage and it continues to perform 5 stars as if it's a brand new item. Thanks for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: John K Bostic

customer_reviews.title: You GOT to get one of these!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't put this thing down! I unwrapped it right when I got home from work. My intention was to spend a minute or two in the front getting the hang of it. An hour later I had edged my front yard, side yard and driveway. Neighbors drove by and slowed down to watch. It doesn't use any fuel, no loud noise on a Saturday morning and for all you gym-rats; this will give your arms a good workout. I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Use the edger the day after a heavy rain. I was not able to make much progress, due to mud constantly building up on the wheel/roller. Why did I edge after a heavy rain? Because the ground would be softer and advice was given to perform the task at the given time. It is too much work and not worth the effort. Fortunately Amazon has a great return policy, so the next day I submitted a return request. This process is super easy, as a barcode was provided to me in which I went to the local UPS and returned the item in the original box and had UPS tape up the box and scan the bar code.
customer_reviews.author: James G. Radler

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work as expected...
customer_reviews.text: I was hopping to use this to edge the sidewalk in front of my house but ended up getting a flat spade instead. If you are looking for something to just to basic maintenance of an edge that should work for you. In my case there was about 6" of overgrown grass. Using this to cut it back was not possible since it couldn't cut through it. I will try it for other areas but if you are looking for something to do a rehab or new edge, then this is not the tool. Go with a spade instead.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Can't over edge with this one :)
customer_reviews.text: I chose this edger over gas, electric or battery. I love a nice edged lawn but, my husband had a bad habit of over doing the width causing bike tires, people to get caught in them and fall. Based on the reviews, as long as we took care of this, it was pretty good being a no frill edger. I have a bad back and I snuck out with this doing a little at a time and was impressed how not to hard this was to push and pull. Hubby saw me and asked if he could use it, silly guy. We now have a nice edged lawn with no over edging possible.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Exercise equipment or lawn tool?  Cant decide...
customer_reviews.text: Here is the deal...if you want to get super ripped doing yard work, this is the tool for you! It does work. It does however take a lot of muscle to get it to trim the overgrown edges. It is probably meant for light maintenance trimming. You will need something much heavier duty to get your overgrown edges to the point where this tool is easy to use. My forearms and back were burning pretty good using this on my corner lot. I remember having one of these at my house when I was a little kid. Once I got a yard of my own though, I havent seen these for sale in any stores...maybe its a sign...
customer_reviews.author: RedTurtleX

customer_reviews.title: Headache Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I'm from the old school where we use this tool to edge our circular driveway. The first one I purchased some 32 years ago at Lowe's or Home Depot has finally lost its sharp edge and doesn't cut through the grass. So not being able to any longer find the tool in our locate hardware stores, I ordered this one. Although it looks the same, it is so hard to get it to move. The instructions says it will be hard at first, but after the 2nd use, I don't find it worth the energy I have to use to get it moving. I'd say they are not as good as the old kind. Tires are smaller too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and does a great job. My yard looks like professionals came and edged but really I just shoved this thing around for half an hour. It doesn’t even require much weight behind it to cut cleanly. I highly recommend. Also, no worries about flying debris like with the gas and electric powered edgers.
customer_reviews.author: Customer 1

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy product.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this style edger for over 30 years and ordered this one recently because mine had worn out after many years. This is a flimsy product. The wood handle feels as if it might break when using. The metal frame that holds the cutting wheel for edging bent with first use. Please note, I am a 68 yr old female and would expect this to withstand the force I am able to exert. I am disappointed and would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste ur money
customer_reviews.text: Used to edge my lawn but horrible very hard to use u have to keep going back and forth several times to get a decent edge it came we no instructions or recommended use nothing I wasted $65 on a piece of junk
customer_reviews.author: Barbara delinski

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Some of the reviewers have reported that until you get a good edge in your lawn that this is hard to move. Or it at least may require several back and forth movements over the same patch of lawn. I have not found that to be true. It edges very nicely and gives m the ability to work in areas when my cordless electric edger is more awkward to use. I highly recommend this. I am a 71 year old man and so-so shape.
customer_reviews.author: Dan in Baltimore

customer_reviews.title: Great manual edger
customer_reviews.text: This manual edger works great. It is a workout, but worth every penny. It's durable and I spray preservative lubricant on it after washing it off before I put it away. Used it twice now and it's very useful, plus I never have to worry about if it will start like the gas powered edgers. It also doesn't damage my sidewalks. I'd buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't fully convinced this was going to work, pleasantly surprised! Bought this since my husband doesn't do the edging every week, and in summer here in south Florida grass grows very fast this time of year. So, rather than nag him, bought this to do it myself during those in between times he doesn't. The manual edger takes a little getting used to, but once you realize it can do the job and relax a bit, it works great. Recommend that you first make an edge, if you don't already have one, with a shovel or gas powered tool and then use this manual edged to keep the manicured lawn appeal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: I've used this thing now for one season, so I can't comment on long-term reliability/quality. But it does seem well made and sturdy. I find that I have to use it in a back and forth motion for tougher Bermuda grass. And you do have to bear down a bit and exert yourself. It isn't casual labor but on the other hand you shouldn't wear yourself out if you have average physical condition.
customer_reviews.author: Seneca reader

customer_reviews.title: no risk of stuff flying at you and easy to manage
customer_reviews.text: We gave up on gas edgers and line edgers. No luck keeping them running. They were big and bulky to use. This thing is low tech and full proof. No sparks, no risk of stuff flying at you and easy to manage. And it is quiet for the neighbors. My husband is now willing to edge He had left it to me before, but he likes this. You do need to establish an edge for ease of use. It will take elbow grease at first. But once the edge is there, it's quick and reliable and easy to store. Super cheap when compared.to other methods plus you get exercise. Now that earns you a beer!
customer_reviews.author: T. Schendel

customer_reviews.title: Not what it use to be
customer_reviews.text: We owned one of these many years ago. Moved to Colorado from Arizona where we needed to trim the grass. This tool is not nearly as smooth as the older model was. In fact, it was so hard to use we donated it. We recommend the electric edger over this manual model. Total waste of money. Overpriced as well.
customer_reviews.author: Honestly

customer_reviews.title: Challenge to use when you're tall
customer_reviews.text: Works just like I remember from when I was a kid, however, the reviews mentioning wetting the area first are spot on. As a tall person I also found that the position of the stationary cutting blades are not conducive to standing up straight when using the tool. Doing so will position the blade to where it cuts little to nothing. I found I had to bend over a fair bit and lower the angle of the handle to the ground in order for more cutting to happen; making it a challenge to use. Enough so to make me consider spending the extra $60 to get a motorized edger.
customer_reviews.author: LaVon Dresen

customer_reviews.title: Use weekly. The first time is a huge pain.  Each subsequent use is a breeze.
customer_reviews.text: The first time you use it to create the edges will be a pain in the butt. Each subsequent weekend it's a snap. I recommend working backwards into the uncut edge instead of forwards and using a short, back-and-forth or "scrubbing" technique to saw through the dirt and grass. Also, it might be tough on your back, but I found it best to grip down low as the handle wants to twist in the thick stuff. Lastly, use a blower to clean out the crevices otherwise you just get to excavate the same dirt and clippings next weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Pommerer

customer_reviews.title: Inner wheel wear out
customer_reviews.text: The Truper 32100 Tru Tough Rotary Lawn Edger rubber wheels lasted almost 3 years on out first unit. The second unit lasted only 3 months with the inner wheel completely disintegrating. The materials used in the initial design were visually and physically superior to the unit I purchased 3 months ago. I would suggest those who are trying to stay environmentally conscious purchase a battery powered lawn edger instead.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce M St Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Makes a nice edge
customer_reviews.text: The first three times I used the edger, I was cutting through all the grass overlapping the sidewalk and any thatch. It was hard to use. Now that there is a groove established, the edger rolls along and the lawn looks nice and crisp. I edge before I mow.
customer_reviews.author: M. Heiss

customer_reviews.title: Works well if you take your time.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product to edge the curb near my street, it works great. Once you have started the edge, the next time is easy. The harder you try to force it the more labor intensive it becomes, just be easy and take your time letting the blades do their job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Foolproof for perfect edges. difficult for the first use
customer_reviews.text: I don't have too much edging to do. We used these in the Army. Foolproof for perfect edges. difficult for the first use, but once the trench is in, works perfect every time. Get lots of compliments on the perfect edges on my yard and have yet to see an electric one gas weed eater based edger that makes as perfect of an edge.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Turner

customer_reviews.title: No brainer!
customer_reviews.text: Wow...I was skeptical since it didn't have a motor, but I wanted something affordable and quiet. The reviews were great so made the purchase. Most reviews stated that it's the most difficult the first time around, and I didn't even think it was that hard! My grass was completely over growing on to the sidewalk, but this made it super easy to trim up. I actually can't wait for the grass to settle in and get used to it's new cut! Very easy to use and highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Roel Buenaventura

customer_reviews.title: Not as young as I thought !
customer_reviews.text: Amazon I would rate with 5 stars because of your service to the consumer which is amazing, thanks; but I forgot myself when I ordered this edger; this tool is made for the young person, and not made for a 70 year old. It work well as I struggled to get it to work for me; its not the tools fault; its the user's fault; I thought I could still do what I used to do when I was young ! LMAO; but I will continue to use it as best that I can! If I was younger I could most likely give the tool a 5 star rating! Sincerely, Bernard Enarson
customer_reviews.author: Bernard D Enarson

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Makes perfect cuts... it takes a lot of work in the beginning put if you keep it up takes no time afterwards. Also a GOOD WORK OUT FOR YOUR ARMS.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Yard Tool !!
customer_reviews.text: Glad I found this edger again. It only needs some elbow grease to get the curb nice and neat. It has no lines to replace; no gasoline to power; no cord to contend with. I had one just like it when I lived in Houston and I was always proud of my neat curbs and driveway. I wholeheartedly recommend this tool for every garage.
customer_reviews.author: Marta Von Runge

customer_reviews.title: Bought this as a cheap alternative to an expensive gas ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a cheap alternative to an expensive gas powered or electrical edger. This thing works.... but it runs on 100% elbow grease. It takes me about an hour to do a 5 minute gas powered edger's job. Pro's - no pollution - cheap - "builds character"? (like something my Grandpa would say) Con's - immense physical exertion - blisters.
customer_reviews.author: Chesterfield Copperpot

customer_reviews.title: Handy and what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I like it and I don't like it. It's easy to use yet if a person is not strong to cut at first pass then back-and-force behind. This was while creating new flower bed areas. Works ok for grass. I wouldn't give it up as it's good in some situations & places but I did decide to replace my string edger. Sure still wishing hubby would have told me he was getting rid of my inherited-from-my-dad's Troy-Bilt gas edger. I would have "guarded" it. Might still be a grrr there. Lol!
customer_reviews.author: VIP - a Customer!

customer_reviews.title: Better than a string trimmer on thick grass, but it's hard work, and a little slow.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. The first time was hard work, but after that, it's easier. The metal is a bit soft though, so it bends if I push hard, which I have to do in the overgrown spots. It's better than a string trimmer on the thick, overgrown spots, but I think I'll alternate with the string trimmer now that I've used this to get a good edge.
customer_reviews.author: K. B.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this edger for the first time and it was definitely a workout but let me tell you that my driveway, patio and walkway look so very beautiful nowl!!! I am so happy that I purchased this because my yard looks so manicured as never before! I love this edger because it cuts the unwanted grass perfectly and it looks very professional! Definitely a keeper!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathlyth

customer_reviews.title: Issues already
customer_reviews.text: The three stars are for Amazon’s great delivery service. I unpacked the lawn edger and noticed that some of the tines were not alined and crooked. Also, there was paint already coming off the attached handle that showed rust. It looks like it was previously used or something. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Klee

customer_reviews.title: LOOKIN' GOOD NOW!
customer_reviews.text: Works better at maintaining a neater edge than my gas trimmer and I save gas and time. With the gas trimmer it is easier to mistakingly remove grass that you did not want to remove and there was more clean-up. It is faster than the gas trimmer and more efficient. I also enjoy the little exercise I get but not hard. The first time you may work up a good sweat but after that it is MUCH faster. By your third time using it, you will indeed appreciate why you bought it. I highly recommend that you wash it after every use and spray it with WD40 or another protectant for years of use.
customer_reviews.author: ISLNDR

customer_reviews.title: Multiple passes to properly cut the grass
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, this tool did not cut my thick Bermuda grass very well, so I sharpened the cutting surfaces (which were totally dull) and also removed the clear lacquer and applied a couple coats of boiled linseed oil. The tool cut the grass better, but still required multiple passes (and a lot of elbow grease) to completely edge my lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Rob the ToolmanTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: nice workout. wetting the area helps.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this and so much for guaranteed 2 day delivery for prime members. I was very disappointed on the late arrival. Amazon offered a 5 dollar credit...what JOY! The tool works great though. It's very sturdy and blades were sharp. It takes some getting used to for first timers like myself but wetting the area and bending down over the tool helps create a nice clean line while giving you a decent workout. Got this because the price was reasonable and I wanted something that wouldn't have continuous future costs..as in buying supplies for this tool. Love the results so far..
customer_reviews.author: mbk

customer_reviews.title: Handle Damage
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed to receive a unit with a broken handle. I gave it a very low rating because it doesn't seem too sturdy to have the handle brake before it is used for the first time and would be very difficult to use in the present condition.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Duckworth

customer_reviews.title: Manual Edger
customer_reviews.text: The first time is difficult to make a path. It does get easier with each attempt. The edger does seem sturdy and gets the job done. The price is much less expensive than a motorized one but takes more effort.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Laurel

customer_reviews.title: Power up
customer_reviews.text: Simple tool , works well, but on your first use, depending on your grass, you have to put alot of manpower into edging. Still great results. After the 1st use, maintaining the edge is alot easier, not as much manpower
customer_reviews.author: Charles Kindley

customer_reviews.title: Edges, but be prepared to put in some force.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a lawn edger to tidy up my lawns that hadn't been edged in years, but didn't want to deal with a 2-stroke powered edger, cords, or the cost of a battery powered edger. The Truper edger required a great deal of muscle the first time I used it, but subsequent edgings proceeded without anywhere near as much effort. My lawns don't quite look like they were edged by a landscaping service, but they look much better than before.
customer_reviews.author: R. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Really a good edging tool
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. My only issue is that the wooden handle is in my opinion a bit too small in diameter. I believe if it were about 1/4" to 3/8" thicker it would be much easier to use. But it is still a really good tool for edging, the cutting head is well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Jarhead

customer_reviews.title: Manual Lawn Edger Works
customer_reviews.text: This is working tool, since it is manual tool, very quiet other than you may be sweating and making noises yourself! You don't need to go to any gym anymore! You can start your lawn edging quietly even at 7AM, if required so. Overall, very good tool to have which works but hard manual labor is essential! Please don't underestimate manual labor needed for this task at least for the first time lawn edging. Subsequent lawn edging will be very smooth.
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: Buy band aids and some gloves
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to save money and not buy an electric or gas powered edger. This just does not work well. The actual rotor gets stuck. It's not very sharp. I have lots of blisters.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: There was no way this product would produce the expected edging that needed to be done with easy or in the time constraints available.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: Its an okay tool. Don't buy this if you dont have a lot of stamina. I recommend using a powered tool but this is great for maintaing and edge that has already been cut. Also it doesnt feel like it will last too long if you arent careful.
customer_reviews.author: Raiane & Leonardo Youssef

customer_reviews.title: Good trimmer - I almost gave it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.text: This replaces my old trimmer - at least 50 yrs old. This one is not as sturdily constructed - but, then again what is nowadays. I've used it 2-3x it does a good, good job.
customer_reviews.author: Canard_Av8r

customer_reviews.title: Clean Cut, but Still a Lot of Work
customer_reviews.text: This edger is definitely better than my previous single-wheeled model. You can cut straight lines in "lawn only" areas like where the lawn meets the flower bed and so on (mainly because of the stability of the double wheels. The first pass through an overgrown sidewalk edge is still a LOT of work. I was hoping for sharper blades or expecting a little easier cut. Had to do lots of little back and forths and was very tired afterwards. The end result though was nice and subsequent cuts a little easier if you do it every 3rd week or so.
customer_reviews.author: L. Sosa

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: This tool works very well and is exactly what I required. Having read previous reviews I did take the time to pre-edge the area next to the concrete so the blades would not have to cut through the accumulated dirt. It cuts clean and is super easy to use. I anticipate many years of use from it. Best of all it just uses "people power" - no electricity or gas required.
customer_reviews.author: Margo

customer_reviews.title: Hard work!
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps my expectations were too high, but this edger is not easy to use. Even after establishing a trench along my sidewalk and driveway this edger is still a lot of hard work and doesn't make as clean a line as I would like. I have reverted back to using the weed-eater to do the edging so I can save my back. Well made product though with no mechanical issues, just wish it were easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: I love this edger
customer_reviews.text: I love this edger. I have a smaller yard and almost bought a gas edger but couldn't justify the expense. Then I found this. At first it was a little difficult trying to edge after 2 years of not edging, but went smoothly once I got the hang of it. Now I do it after every mowing. The edges look good and I'm happy with my purchase. Is of good quality too
customer_reviews.author: nathan shalashnow

customer_reviews.title: One of my funnest lawn tools
customer_reviews.text: Why would you buy an empowered one of these. It is fun to use this thing! May take a couple passes to get all the grass but looks sharp once your done.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Augustine Schmit

customer_reviews.title: love this!
customer_reviews.text: my mom used one of these when i was growing up and I love using it. i like it because it edges perfectly and creates a small "ditch" line between the pavement and the lawn.
customer_reviews.author: dreaming420

customer_reviews.title: Truper 32100 Tru Tough Rotary lawn edger
customer_reviews.text: Item as discribed, made well, sturdy enough, wrapped well , the only thing I was disappointed with was how long it took to arrive, ordered on the 28th and arrived on the 10th , other then that all good.
customer_reviews.author: John (Bull Dog)

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in product
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, it just doesn't cut or trim like the edgers of yesteryear. I felt that it was a little too expensive for the quality of the product. But because you can't find them in the stores anywhere, I had no choice but to go on line and buy it here. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky G.

customer_reviews.title: Two Thumbs Up
customer_reviews.text: I bought an Ames brand at Home Depot a few days prior to buying this Truper and this one is far superior. Same design but the previous Ames bent within 5min. The Truper lasted around the yard creating nice edges.
customer_reviews.author: wine.wife

customer_reviews.title: Great product of it didn't break
customer_reviews.text: First time using this item, the wood snappedin half. The concept is great and very good to use. Maybe mine was just defective? Idk but the wood that the stick is made of on the inside appeared rotten almost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I prefer this to a motorized one. I don’t mind manual labor. Used it to trim along the driveway. Once I got years of grass gone it’s much easier to maintain.
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: Not for Florida Grass
customer_reviews.text: Based on the majority of reviews, I was looking forward to receipt of this product. Unfortunately, it didn't work for me. It wasn't the manual force required that bothered me, as the only real exercise I get is from using manual gardening equipment and I enjoy it (mostly). It may be that this edger is simply not meant to edge Florida St Augustine "grass," which to me as a former New Englander, doesn't feel or act at all like the "real" grass I'm used to up North.
customer_reviews.author: thomashardy

customer_reviews.title: You're joking right?
customer_reviews.text: You're joking with this pos right? 5 minutes and it's bent and unusable. Not strong enough to cut a cingle layer of grass.. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Don't get it expecting it to be like a gas or electric trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Don't get it expecting it to be like a gas or electric trimmer,,,,that wasn't what I wanted,,,once you get your line made it is pretty easy but it takes a little bit of time to do this,,,,you roll and push it back and forward small sections at a time until you get it like you want then move on up,,,,it leaves a neater trim,,,,it also helps to build up your upper body muscles,,,at least a little more exercise than I was getting which is what I was going after,,,but all in all I am very well pleased with it,,,,just takes a little getting used to but I am enjoying adding this to my hobby,,,,Diane
customer_reviews.author: Diane Parrish

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Old faithful for lawn edging. By the time one gets the cord and drags out the electric one, the yard is done with this timeless device.
customer_reviews.author: CarolSchrillo

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and durable
customer_reviews.text: We replaced an old hand edger with this model. My husband uses it weekly during the summer months here in Michigan and it is very durable and lightweight. He is very happy with this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Sharer

customer_reviews.title: but the tires are not as good as on my old one
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, but the tires are not as good as on my old one: the old one had soft tires that grabbed the pavement better than these, which seem harder and grip less well. But this tool does exactly what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: It is sturdy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I searched all over for this old school edger. This edger is well made. It is sturdy and easy to use. It works best if the ground is damp to wet. My lawn looks awesome. My son says the I gave the lawn a buzz cut.
customer_reviews.author: VBower

customer_reviews.title: Edger
customer_reviews.text: This is probably more for a man to use rather than a woman. Kind of hard to push but it does a good job.
customer_reviews.author: patticake2012

customer_reviews.title: Love My Manual Edger
customer_reviews.text: Love my manual lawn edger and have no need for a gas or electric weed eater. This manual edger gives my yard a clean and precise look. The gas edgers leave yards with chopped up edge lines and uneven depth. My entire yard is even and looks beautiful. Great workout also so be prepared for some toned biceps & triceps. This is ideal for a small to medium size yard; for a larger yard of course I would something more powerful and less time consuming.
customer_reviews.author: Karanta

customer_reviews.title: Worst product ever
customer_reviews.text: It does not have a soft rubber tire. The tire does not get enough friction to turn the cutting blade. It needs to be redesigned.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Works like it should
customer_reviews.text: Works great for smaller lawns (like mine in SoCal). First use, as described elsewhere, may take a bit more work to establish the grooves and cut back overgrown lawns, but each use after then is no issue if you do it regularly. I have the double wheel model which tracks easily. Takes up very little space, gives you a light workout (big the first use) , and consumes zero gas. I recommend using a blower with this to make cleanup quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Edger
customer_reviews.text: When I tried to buy one of these at one of the home-superstores, the guy didn't have any idea what I was even talking about - he told me I needed to buy one of the electric ones. NO THANKS. I've used this about 6 times now and it cuts very well. It's also lighter in weight than the one I've had for 40 years and that's a nice feature also.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: My lawn was so overgrown with weeds that, using ...
customer_reviews.text: My lawn was so overgrown with weeds that, using a power edger, the other lawn edgers would grab a large clump of weeds and pull that edger into them (making severe nicks in the lawn. With this hand edger, I've been able to overcome that problem and the lawn now looks neatly trimmed! I was impressed with the on-time delivery and the quality of this tool as well. It was delivered exactly as advertised and the quality was even more than I expected for the price. It's truly heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: I do love it.
customer_reviews.text: I do love it.... but then I'm a glutton for punishment. I like working outside and pushing myself - my husband thinks I'm crazy. Where I have edged looks very nice though. It's not something you can do fast because it really is a lot of physical labor... but if you don't want to spend 3-4 hundred bucks on an edger and deal with either gas or having to drag around an extension cord.... this baby is the answer.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri B.

customer_reviews.title: Buy and learn.
customer_reviews.text: Head bent after 15 minutes, couldn't handle my awful lawn crabgrass, and teeth were bent during shipping. Got clogged constantly too. Just spend the money and get a powered edger. This thing sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Manually edges thick grass
customer_reviews.text: This tool does exactly what it purports to do: edge lawns. But on thick grass it can also be a tool of self-punishment if you use this over an electric edger.
customer_reviews.author: A.

customer_reviews.title: Best garden tool I own
customer_reviews.text: Best garden tool I own. Used it right away. I already have a groove so I didn't have to make one. Cuts neatly and my grass edge looks very nice. So worth the $.
customer_reviews.author: June Agresti

customer_reviews.title: Works just like it should but does take a little practice to ...
customer_reviews.text: Works just like it should but does take a little practice to master. Once you get a nice edge established, it only takes a couple minutes per month to maintain a nice clean edge around sidewalks and driveways
customer_reviews.author: THEODORE M ZIMMERLY

customer_reviews.title: It works well, even with stubborn Bermuda grass
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised. I used it to edge around my pool and patio. It takes extra work and time to get it done. But you do get a nice edge without using any fossil fuel.
customer_reviews.author: Amz customer

customer_reviews.title: Best. Product. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: This is my new favorite lawn tool. It is easy to use, and leaves a very nice, crisp edge. I didn't want to get a solid metal edger because I do not need another tool with an engine to maintain. Plus you get a good workout, once you get a rhythm and technique going. I hope to use this on the lawn for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: G G

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Edger
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Cuts really nice on well maintained edges. Hopefully you already have nice edges, in which case this is a breeze. If you've let things get overgrown, you can expect a lot of work and a few blisters.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Just Right For Homeowners
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I was looking for. It is not really heavy duty - if you are a professional landscaper this will not hold up. But it is great for a homeowner like me. I keeps edges looking sharp. Well made, nicely designed. Easy to wield. No complaints. If your edges have gotten very overgrown, as mine had, you will need either a hoe or a half-moon edger to get them unburied. Once unburied and cleaned up, a quick pass with this tool every 2 weeks or so keeps them looking sharp.
customer_reviews.author: MA Gardener

customer_reviews.title: A great manual edger!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality edger. My lawn is tough St Augustine grass so the first time using it took some effort, however, I knew this when I bought it and don't mind the exercise. Once the initial edge is established future use is much easier. The edger is well made and gets the job done. I am very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: j_m1964

customer_reviews.title: Night time yard work
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gets the work done at night. It is too hot in the Texas sun to do yard work during the daylight hours.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Skaggs

customer_reviews.title: Great Edger.
customer_reviews.text: This is excellent based on the price match against the other products. We use it about once every 3 months and it edges perfectly. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon's biggest customer

customer_reviews.title: I've just started using this edger, and maybe my ...
customer_reviews.text: I've just started using this edger, and maybe my technique will improve--but so far I'm lukewarm about it. The main issue I note with this tool is that its basic function is not cutting; it's yanking. What happens is that, as you run the edger along the margin of your lawn, tufts of grass get caught between the wheel and the housing, and the tool basically uproots the grass, resulting in a tattered border and requiring frequent breaks to clean out the clogged up, accumulated chunks of turf. Using this edger is faster and less hard on the back and hands than stooping down to use a scissors-like clipping tool, but it's far from pleasant and not especially gratifying aesthetically.
customer_reviews.author: Giuseppe Soffiare

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING !!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect edger. Once the groove has been established initially, each subsequent use is very easy.
customer_reviews.author: K Wright

customer_reviews.title: What a great tool for someone with a small yard surrounded with ...
customer_reviews.text: What a great tool for someone with a small yard surrounded with sidewalks. In a few minutes the lawn was edged and looked professionally done by a landscaper. I hose it off and then spray it down with silicone spray and it is ready for the next use. I never have to worry if it will start either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done I would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: Works great, and you get a good workout typical of any Garden/ yard work. Just as I remembered grandfather using years ago
customer_reviews.author: Calligrapher

customer_reviews.title: Works okay, but there is room for improvement.
customer_reviews.text: It would so much better if the blades were sharp.
customer_reviews.author: KenC

customer_reviews.title: Exercise the Edge!
customer_reviews.text: Takes some muscle but so far has broke down like the machines I bought that are electric or gas powered.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan D Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: ... this edger was made well but I just really dislike the blade and design
customer_reviews.text: I thought this edger was made well but I just really dislike the blade and design. It tore up more grass and was erratic on which grass it wanted to eat and which it allowed to stay long. I really wanted an edger that was clean and easy to use and I liked that this one was manual. But it wasn't a good fit for me, I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: Excellentante!
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely superb edger. Easy to use and totally sharp. Cuts with one or two passes. Wish I had gotten this a long time ago and not tried various mechanical ones and other manual ones.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Duckworth

customer_reviews.title: Great value and able to be green
customer_reviews.text: Great and sturdy construction, will give you a workout the first time using it, but once you get the initial edging done this will easily maintain that beautiful landscaped look. The blades cut through grass and soil easily with the proper strength applied, nice self cleaning blades and sturdy ash handle. Package arrived very quickly and no damage.
customer_reviews.author: Cory G

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine for Manicured Look to Your Lawn
customer_reviews.text: This machine for a very low cost gave my lawn a perfect manicure look. Strong 48" handle allows user to stand fairly erect to not cause back problems after use. Sharp blades cut through anything I threw at it. Highly recommend this product for those who want nicely manicured lawns with sharp clean edges.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Rueve

customer_reviews.title: Works better than the electric edger
customer_reviews.text: Works better than the electric edger. It does take some effort to keep it in the right position to be most effective, but the effort is worth the result.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Effective
customer_reviews.text: No battery to die or cord to trip on. Utterly simple to use, leaves a nice clean edge and you don't need hearing protection. Throw in a little healthy exercise and there is nothing not to love about this clever little tool. I've used it every week all summer for the past couple of years and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely ❤️
customer_reviews.text: Get this tool for your lawn. Lawn edges are gorgeous afterwards. Doesn’t take a lot of elbow grease to use. I researched many edgers. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Wright

customer_reviews.title: Makes a nice, straight line along a hard edge (i
customer_reviews.text: Makes a nice, straight line along a hard edge (i.e concrete). Using this device is easy, the first couple attempts take some effort but after that you have a groove and it takes a few swipes to clean the edge. Also helps you get your daily exercise! It doesn't help edging soft edge (or I haven't worked out how).
customer_reviews.author: alfred

customer_reviews.title: First time I used it I didn't like it because it was very hard to edge grass ...
customer_reviews.text: First time I used it I didn't like it because it was very hard to edge grass that was way overgrown. Used a shovel to form a trench now its much better. Only real complaint is that there are no instructions or tips on how to use.
customer_reviews.author: 4harpers

customer_reviews.title: The Sharp And Narrow Path
customer_reviews.text: I have been doing the edging with my string trimmer but wanted better results. This was highly rated so I got it. It indeed makes nice narrow and sharp edges around my walkway unlike when I try turning my string trimmer sideways and edge.
customer_reviews.author: R. CushmanTop Contributor: Magic: The Gathering

product_meta.title: Truper 32100 Tru Tough Rotary Lawn Edger with Dual Wheel and Ash Handle, 48-Inch
product_meta.description: Style:Dual Wheel Rotary Lawn EdgerTruper 32100, ROT-EDG, Tru Tough Rotary Lawn Edger, Dual Wheel, Ash Handle, 48-Inch. 48-inch North American Ash, lacquered handle for strength and durability. Handy edger, keeps sidewalks clear of grass and weeds. Clear-coated gray-steel finished heads. Spray clean with garden hose, coat with silicone spray. Tru-Tough: Trupers Best Selling Signature Tool Line.. Truper has been in the hand tool manufacturing business for over 40 years and is by far the largest Mexican company in its field. Truper relies on the most advanced modern and efficient technology to guarantee the optimum quality and value of its products and demanding service needs of the company's global customers. Tru Tough provides everything a dedicated handyman expects from a serious, long-lasting tool at an unbeatable price. Tru-tough has long been Trupers best selling products. The visual appeal is highlighted by clear-coated gray-steel finished heads, steel collars, lacquered ash handles and heavy duty D-grips. A ten-year free-replacement warranty backs all Tru-tough tools.
